application.Audio

Class getMetadata

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.Audio.getMetadata

  • public class getMetadata
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for handling the metadata of different media file formats. This is what sets the title, artist, and even the soruce of the coverart. Supported formats are: mp3, mp4, wav, and aif.
    Author:
    Spud

    • Method Detail

      • getMp3

        public static java.lang.String[] getMp3(java.io.File file)
        Retuns a string array of 2. The first argument is the artist, the second is the title. Oh, and it also tries to set the album art.
        Parameters:
        file - The file locaion, or path. This needs to be formatted in a way that is URL friendly!
        Returns:
        String[] - Retruns a string array, containing the artist (0), and the title (1).

      • getArtist

        public static java.lang.String getArtist(java.lang.String source)
        Retruns the artist of the song. The source provided needs to be URL friendly!
        Parameters:
        source - The URL of the file.
        Returns:
        String - The artist.
